        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        The stack trace shows the execution path from DidProcessTask[1] to UnregisterObserver[2], which is the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The stack trace shows the execution path from DidProcessTask[1] to UnregisterObserver[2], which is the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>The ASAN log can only see the access violation at DidProcessTask[1] due to the invalidation of the iterator, and it is impossible to see why the iterator is invalid.<span class="line"><!---->The ASAN log can only see the access violation at DidProcessTask[1] due to the invalidation of the iterator, and it is impossible to see why the iterator is invalid.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void LongTaskDetector::DidProcessTask(base::TimeTicks start_time,<span class="line"><!---->void LongTaskDetector::DidProcessTask(base::TimeTicks start_time,<!----></span><br>                                      base::TimeTicks end_time) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      base::TimeTicks end_time) {<!----></span><br>  if ((end_time - start_time) < LongTaskDetector::kLongTaskThreshold)<span class="line"><!---->  if ((end_time - start_time) &lt; LongTaskDetector::kLongTaskThreshold)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br><br>  for (auto& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (auto&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>    observer->OnLongTaskDetected(start_time, end_time);		//[1]<span class="line"><!---->    observer-&gt;OnLongTaskDetected(start_time, end_time);		//[1]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver(LongTaskObserver* observer) {<span class="line"><!---->void LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver(LongTaskObserver* observer) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(IsMainThread());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(IsMainThread());<!----></span><br>  observers_.erase(observer);		//[2]<span class="line"><!---->  observers_.erase(observer);		//[2]<!----></span><br>  if (observers_.size() == 0) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (observers_.size() == 0) {<!----></span><br>    Thread::Current()->RemoveTaskTimeObserver(this);<span class="line"><!---->    Thread::Current()-&gt;RemoveTaskTimeObserver(this);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75"><!---->702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<!----></a><br>Author: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu May 20 15:21:39 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu May 20 15:21:39 2021<!----></span><br><br>[LongTaskDetector] Remove container mutation during iteration<span class="line"><!---->[LongTaskDetector] Remove container mutation during iteration<!----></span><br><br>On LongTaskDetector, we call OnLongTaskDetected for all registered<span class="line"><!---->On LongTaskDetector, we call OnLongTaskDetected for all registered<!----></span><br>observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<span class="line"><!---->observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<!----></span><br>in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<span class="line"><!---->in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<!----></span><br>not allowed during iteration.<span class="line"><!---->not allowed during iteration.<!----></span><br><br>Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<span class="line"><!---->Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1210487<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1210487"         This bug requires manual review: We are only 3 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 3 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative?         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2"><!---->8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<!----></a><br>Author: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue May 25 09:45:50 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue May 25 09:45:50 2021<!----></span><br><br>Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<span class="line"><!---->Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<!----></span><br><br>https://crrev.com/c/2909934<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2909934"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2909934<!----></a> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<span class="line"><!----> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<!----></span><br>copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<span class="line"><!---->copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<!----></span><br>regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate the<span class="line"><!---->regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate the<!----></span><br>regression.<span class="line"><!---->regression.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1210487<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1210487" class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1211539" title="[V8 Memory Perf Sheriff]: 2 regressions in system_health.memory_mobile"><!---->1211539<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ib9101e29d70fadb11b7967754e847bb5cc754feb<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<span class="line"><!---->observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<!----></span><br>in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<span class="line"><!---->in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<!----></span><br>not allowed during iteration.<span class="line"><!---->not allowed during iteration.<!----></span><br><br>Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<span class="line"><!---->Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31"><!---->7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<!----></a><br>Author: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 08 07:29:38 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 08 07:29:38 2021<!----></span><br><br>Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<span class="line"><!---->Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<!----></span><br><br>https://crrev.com/c/2909934<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2909934"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2909934<!----></a> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<span class="line"><!----> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<!----></span><br>copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<span class="line"><!---->copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<!----></span><br>regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate the<span class="line"><!---->regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Congratulations - the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7500 for this report. Nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations - the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7500 for this report. Nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;

      close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

              Discard

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

OnLongTaskDetected iterator in the function OnLongTaskDetected to be invalid, resulting in a security vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->observers_[2] causes the OnLongTaskDetected iterator in the function OnLongTaskDetected to be invalid, resulting in a security vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>//In order to easily reproduce the problem, I invalidated the following code logic<span           patch.diff<b><!---->patch.diff<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->patch.diff<!----></b>
          
        </div>

        The stack trace shows the execution path from DidProcessTask[1] to UnregisterObserver[2], which is the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The stack trace shows the execution path from DidProcessTask[1] to UnregisterObserver[2], which is the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>The ASAN log can only see the access violation at DidProcessTask[1] due to the invalidation of the iterator, and it is impossible to see why the iterator is invalid.<span class="line"><!---->The ASAN log can only see the access violation at DidProcessTask[1] due to the invalidation of the iterator, and it is impossible to see why the iterator is invalid.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void LongTaskDetector::DidProcessTask(base::TimeTicks start_time,<span class="line"><!---->void LongTaskDetector::DidProcessTask(base::TimeTicks start_time,<!----></span><br>                                      base::TimeTicks end_time) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      base::TimeTicks end_time) {<!----></span><br>  if ((end_time - start_time) < LongTaskDetector::kLongTaskThreshold)<span class="line"><!---->  if ((end_time - start_time) &lt; LongTaskDetector::kLongTaskThreshold)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br><br>  for (auto& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (auto&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>    observer->OnLongTaskDetected(start_time, end_time);		//[1]<span class="line"><!---->    observer-&gt;OnLongTaskDetected(start_time, end_time);		//[1]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver(LongTaskObserver* observer) {<span class="line"><!---->void LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver(LongTaskObserver* observer) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(IsMainThread());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(IsMainThread());<!----></span><br>  observers_.erase(observer);		//[2]<span class="line"><!---->  observers_.erase(observer);		//[2]<!----></span><br>  if (observers_.size() == 0) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (observers_.size() == 0) {<!----></span><br>    Thread::Current()->RemoveTaskTimeObserver(this);<span class="line"><!---->    Thread::Current()-&gt;RemoveTaskTimeObserver(this);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75"><!---->702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<!----></a><br>Author: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu May 20 15:21:39 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu May 20 15:21:39 2021<!----></span><br><br>[LongTaskDetector] Remove container mutation during iteration<span class="line"><!---->[LongTaskDetector] Remove container mutation during iteration<!----></span><br><br>On LongTaskDetector, we call OnLongTaskDetected for all registered<span class="line"><!---->On LongTaskDetector, we call OnLongTaskDetected for all registered<!----></span><br>observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<span class="line"><!---->observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<!----></span><br>in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<span class="line"><!---->in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<!----></span><br>not allowed during iteration.<span class="line"><!---->not allowed during iteration.<!----></span><br><br>Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<span class="line"><!---->Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1210487<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1210487"         This bug requires manual review: We are only 3 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 3 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2"><!---->8097e73295a88e64d8318d982847a5e4f2bcc4d2<!----></a><br>Author: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue May 25 09:45:50 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue May 25 09:45:50 2021<!----></span><br><br>Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<span class="line"><!---->Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<!----></span><br><br>https://crrev.com/c/2909934<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2909934"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2909934<!----></a> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<span class="line"><!----> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<!----></span><br>copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<span class="line"><!---->copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<!----></span><br>regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate the<span class="line"><!---->regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate the<!----></span><br>regression.<span class="line"><!---->regression.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1210487<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1210487" class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1211539" title="[V8 Memory Perf Sheriff]: 2 regressions in system_health.memory_mobile"><!---->1211539<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ib9101e29d70fadb11b7967754e847bb5cc754feb<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<span class="line"><!---->observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<!----></span><br>in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<span class="line"><!---->in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<!----></span><br>not allowed during iteration.<span class="line"><!---->not allowed during iteration.<!----></span><br><br>Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<span class="line"><!---->Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31"><!---->7be6a34fe2f01af881bb074bc616bf5b6b5f7c31<!----></a><br>Author: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 08 07:29:38 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 08 07:29:38 2021<!----></span><br><br>Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<span class="line"><!---->Reduce memory consumption on LongTaskObserver::DidProcessTask<!----></span><br><br>https://crrev.com/c/2909934<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2909934"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2909934<!----></a> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<span class="line"><!----> fixed a security issue, but it introduced a<!----></span><br>copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<span class="line"><!---->copy operation for each DidProcessTask for a long task. We see a memory<!----></span><br>regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate the<span class="line"><!---->regression on the change, and this is an attempt to mitigate         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Congratulations - the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7500 for this report. Nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations - the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7500 for this report. Nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;

      close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

              Discard

          width: 100%;

          margin: auto;

          flex-direction: row;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

        mr-issue-details {

        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

          Comment 7<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210487#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 20, 2021, 5:28 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210487#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 20, 2021, 5:28 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210487#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 20, 2021, 5:28 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The stack trace shows the execution path from DidProcessTask[1] to UnregisterObserver[2], which is the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The stack trace shows the execution path from DidProcessTask[1] to UnregisterObserver[2], which is the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>The ASAN log can only see the access violation at DidProcessTask[1] due to the invalidation of the iterator, and it is impossible to see why the iterator is invalid.<span class="line"><!---->The ASAN log can only see the access violation at DidProcessTask[1] due to the invalidation of the iterator, and it is impossible to see why the iterator is invalid.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void LongTaskDetector::DidProcessTask(base::TimeTicks start_time,<span class="line"><!---->void LongTaskDetector::DidProcessTask(base::TimeTicks start_time,<!----></span><br>                                      base::TimeTicks end_time) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      base::TimeTicks end_time) {<!----></span><br>  if ((end_time - start_time) < LongTaskDetector::kLongTaskThreshold)<span class="line"><!---->  if ((end_time - start_time) &lt; LongTaskDetector::kLongTaskThreshold)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br><br>  for (auto& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (auto&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>    observer->OnLongTaskDetected(start_time, end_time);		//[1]<span class="line"><!---->    observer-&gt;OnLongTaskDetected(start_time, end_time);		//[1]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver(LongTaskObserver* observer) {<span class="line"><!---->void LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver(LongTaskObserver* observer) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(IsMainThread());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(IsMainThread());<!----></span><br>  observers_.erase(observer);		//[2]<span class="line"><!---->  observers_.erase(observer);		//[2]<!----></span><br>  if (observers_.size() == 0) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (observers_.size() == 0) {<!----></span><br>    Thread::Current()->RemoveTaskTimeObserver(this);<span class="line"><!---->    Thread::Current()-&gt;RemoveTaskTimeObserver(this);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75"><!---->702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<!----></a><br>Author: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu May 20 15:21:39 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu May 20 15:21:39 2021<!----></span><br><br>[LongTaskDetector] Remove container mutation during iteration<span class="line"><!---->[LongTaskDetector] Remove container mutation during iteration<!----></span><br><br>On LongTaskDetector, we call OnLongTaskDetected for all registered<span class="line"><!---->On LongTaskDetector, we call OnLongTaskDetected for all registered<!----></span><br>observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<span class="line"><!---->observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<!----></span><br>in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<span class="line"><!---->in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<!----></span><br>not allowed during iteration.<span class="line"><!---->not allowed during iteration.<!----></span><br><br>Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<span class="line"><!---->Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1210487<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1210487"         Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<span class="line"><!---->observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<!----></span><br>in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<span class="line"><!---->in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<!----></span><br>not allowed during iteration.<span class="line"><!---->not allowed during iteration.<!----></span><br><br>Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<span class="line"><!---->Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75"><!---->702f4d4ddb963cafb0d133972282dfc803510b75<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1210487<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1210487" title="AddressSanitizer: use-after-poison long_task_detector.cc:46 in blink::LongTaskDetector::DidProcessTask"><!---->Bug: 1210487<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Iccea748ac144def6884be8cf542cdc3572bed81a<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Iccea748ac144def6884be8cf542cdc3572bed81a<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2909934<a href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2909934"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2909934<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Deep Roy <<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<span class="line"><!---->observers. Some observers call LongTaskDetector::UnregisterObserver<!----></span><br>in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<span class="line"><!---->in the callback, which is problematic because container mutation is<!----></span><br>not allowed during iteration.<span class="line"><!---->not allowed during iteration.<!----></span><br><br>Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<span class="line"><!---->Copy the observer set to avoid the violation.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit
